conversation.content: [hesitantly] They called me into the office this morning and I thought—I honestly thought I was getting let go too. [nervous laugh] But then Richards starts talking about, um, "exceptional performance during challenging times" and [confused] I'm sitting there watching Sarah pack her desk through the glass wall. [long pause] Twenty-three years she's been here. [very sad] Her daughter just started college and now she's—[clearing throat] anyway, they're making me Senior Restructuring Advisor. [bitter] That's what they're calling it. I get to help decide who else [slowly] doesn't make the cut. [sigh] Like, congratulations, here's more money to basically tell your friends they're redundant. [upset] Tom already knows he's next week—he told me at lunch, [voice shaking] crying into his sandwich. And I just sat there knowing I'd be the one writing his termination memo. [very quietly] How do I even celebrate this? My wife wants to take me to dinner but [trailing off] I mean, what am I supposed to say? [sarcastic] "Honey, great news, I got promoted because everyone else got fired"? [long pause] I keep thinking about Sarah's face when security walked her out. [regretful] Maybe I should've just—[frustrated] God, I don't know what's right anymore.

subject: Getting promoted to senior restructuring advisor while watching colleagues you genuinely care about lose their jobs
